title: Question 51: Why is it called the Lord’s Day?
question: Why is it called the Lord’s Day?
answer: Because on that day Christ rose from the dead.

title: Question 52: How should the Sabbath be kept?
question: How should the Sabbath be kept?
answer: In prayer and praise, in hearing and reading God’s Word, and in doing good to our fellow men.

title: Question 53: What is the fifth commandment?
question: What is the fifth commandment?
answer: The fifth commandment is, 'Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.'

title: Question 54: What does the fifth commandment teach us?
question: What does the fifth commandment teach us?
answer: To love and obey our parents.

title: Question 55: What is the sixth commandment?
question: What is the sixth commandment?
answer: The sixth commandment is, 'You shall not murder.'

title: Question 56: What does the sixth commandment teach us?
question: What does the sixth commandment teach us?
answer: To avoid hatred, all that leads to it, and all that follows from it.

title: Question 57: What is the seventh commandment?
question: What is the seventh commandment?
answer: The seventh commandment is, 'You shall not commit adultery.'

title: Question 58: What does the seventh commandment teach us?
question: What does the seventh commandment teach us?
answer: To be pure in heart, language and conduct.

title: Question 59: What is the eighth commandment?
question: What is the eighth commandment?
answer: The eighth commandment is, 'You shall not steal.'

title: Question 60: What does the eighth commandment teach us?
question: What does the eighth commandment teach us?
answer: To be honest and not to take the things of others.

title: Question 61: What is the ninth commandment?
question: What is the ninth commandment?
answer: The ninth commandment is, 'You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.'

title: Question 62: What does the ninth commandment teach us?
question: What does the ninth commandment teach us?
answer: To tell the truth and not to speak evil of others.

title: Question 63: What is the tenth commandment?
question: What is the tenth commandment?
answer: The tenth commandment is, 'You shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his male servant, or his female servant, or his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor’s.'

title: Question 64: What does the tenth commandment teach us?
question: What does the tenth commandment teach us?
answer: To be content with what we have.

title: Question 65: Can any man keep these ten commandments?
question: Can any man keep these ten commandments?
answer: No mere man, since the fall of Adam, ever did or can keep the ten commandments perfectly.

title: Question 66: Of what use are the ten commandments to us?
question: Of what use are the ten commandments to us?
answer: They teach us our duty, make clear our condemnation, and show us our need of a Saviour.

title: Question 67: Does God condemn all men?
question: Does God condemn all men?
answer: No. Though he could justly have done so he has graciously entered into a covenant to save many.
